subject: Personal Finance
title: Mental Accounting
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Mental Accounting.

hook.text: You won't touch savings but happily blow a $500 tax refund. Both are your money.

buildup.text: Mental accounting means treating money differently depending on its source or intended purpose.

twist.text: This can be useful. Putting money in labeled 'buckets' â€” rent, food, fun â€” helps some people budget.

climax.text: But it can also hurt. Keeping $5,000 in low-interest savings while carrying $5,000 in high-interest debt is irrational.

punchline.text: Money is fungible. Our brains disagree.

quiz.question: What is mental accounting?
options: Treating money differently based on its source or label
